position.marginalia_text: Mens cuiusq[ue] est quisq[ue]. Mentis magnitudo, pro virtutum, artiumq[ue] quantitate.

marginalia.translation: The mind of everyone is everything. The greatness of the mind before the quantity of virtues and arts.
A virile aphorism and clever epigram.

position.marginalia_text: Nihil molestat philosophu[m], aut turbat virum. Epictetus non curat, qua[e] non sunt in sua potestate.

marginalia.translation: Everything in one. Nothing bothers a philosopher or upsets a man. Epictetus did not worry about those things which were not in his power.

position.marginalia_text: Si Cynismus per se tantus: quantò maior, efficacissimis artibus instructus.

marginalia.translation: If Cynicism is great in itself, it would be much greater still if instructed in the most efficient arts.

position.marginalia_text: Orthopoedia statim ediscit, et operatur, qua[e] sunt cuiusq[ue] artis vtilissima. Non magis Cebetis, aut Epicteti Orthopoedia, quàm Axiophili: minùs etia[m], quàm Eudromi.

marginalia.translation: Orthopedia must be learned by heart immediately, and that which is most usefull for every art must be carried out. The Orthopedia of Cebes and Epictetus no more than that of Axiophilus, even less than that of Eudromus.

position.marginalia_text: Orthopa[e]dia Virtus: sed peritior Orthopa[e]dia, quò Arte excultior.

marginalia.translation: Orthopedia is Virtue, but a more skilled Orthopedia is more developed than Art.
